comment.author: 30892984@N06
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called La foto imperfecta., and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Another Bain/LOC photo of the Gunboat Smith vs. Arthur Pelkey fight in San Francisco [Daly City] on January 1, 1914: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4668752209/in/photostream/] "After thirty seconds figiting in the fifteenth round Smith feinted with his left, then swung his right with lightning-like rapidity. The blow landed with a crash on Pelkey's unprotected jaw. Pelkey dropped with his eyes glassy. Mechanically he struggled to his feet at the count of nine and unsteadily assumed his fighting pose. A left and right applied similarly toppled him and he was out when Referee Griffin awarded the fight to Smith." --From NYT report, 1/2/14. Story in New York Times, January 2, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9D02E...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Note to LOC: The correct spelling of the name is "Pelkey." The date of the fight was January 1, 1914 -- not January 8.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Wystan,

Thanks for the further information on this fight.  As you can see in the record, and on the negative, Bain recorded the date of Jan. 8, 1914, and we qualify those dates as possibly later than the event and sometimes the date of publication or acquisition by Bain.  We will also add the date of the event itself  (Jan. 1, 1914) to the record when we expand the descriptive details, and clarify the difference between those two dates.
